step.title: Before Stretching
step.content: Before stretching in any direction, pull up your spine as straight as possible, then “retract” your chin towards your neck. The muscles you are stretching are small and delicate: start low, and go slow.

step.title: Pull Up
step.content:
Keep your head level (not bending forward or back), do not tug or shove neck, and gently press on your chin for a deeper stretch.

Start by holding for only about five to 10 seconds, then more each day.

step.title: Retract
step.content:
Keep your head level (not bending forward or back), do not tug or shove neck, and gently press on your chin for a deeper stretch.

Start by holding for only about five to 10 seconds, then more each day.

step.title: Deeper Stretch
step.content:
Keep your head level (not bending forward or back), do not tug or shove neck, and gently press on your chin for a deeper stretch.

Start by holding for only about five to 10 seconds, then more each day.

step.title: Flexion (chin to chest)
step.content:
Keep your head level (not bending forward or back), do not tug or shove neck, and gently press on your chin for a deeper stretch.

Start by holding for only about five to 10 seconds, then more each day.

step.title: Lateral flexion (Ear to shoulder)
step.content:
Keep your head level (not bending forward or back), do not tug or shove neck, and gently press on your chin for a deeper stretch.

Start by holding for only about five to 10 seconds, then more each day.

step.title: Rotation (Turn)
step.content:
Keep your head level (not bending forward or back), do not tug or shove neck, and gently press on your chin for a deeper stretch.

Start by holding for only about five to 10 seconds, then more each day.
